trans-unit.source: Data and infographic about russian losses during invasion of Ukraine
Russian losses in Ukraine: In-Depth statistics and infographic
Constantly updating data about Russian losses in the ongoing Russian invasion of Ukraine
Hey, I am using Google Analytics to collect data about your visit to know which languages to translate the site into next. Therefore I need your consent for using cookies. Do you agree?

I am a software developer based in Kyiv, Ukraine. I dedicated my life to programming and technology. And it would be a sin if I had not used my skills to develop something that could potentially help a good cause: bring additional attention to the ongoing War in Ukraine.
To bring additional awareness to the ongoing War in Ukraine and to demonstrate the strength and effectiveness of Ukraine's defense against russian occupying forces.
Your support can make a difference
in this crucial fight for freedom and sovereignty.
This site is group of applications.
Scrapper app for scrapping data of russian losses from two sources: Ministry of defense of Ukraine and Oryx OSINT :
Backend app for processing storing and providing access to data:
Frontend app for displaying data, which You can observe on this site:

Backend Node.js app periodically (on schedule) runs scraping, receives data and persists it in mongo DB. Frontend app is Angular Application on bleeding-edge Angular17 with brand new SSR support. Most data grouping is performed on frontend to minimize network traffic.
Your feedback and support are invaluable. If you come across any bugs or have suggestions to improve this site, please don't hesitate to reach out.
Together, we stand with Ukraine. Every contribution, big or small, makes a difference.

Select full range since the start of the invasion
On February 24th, 2022, the world witnessed the stark reality of russian imperialistic aggression in Ukraine.
Since then, Ukraine has been a symbol of resilience, bravely confronting against military superpower. It's a battle not only for land but for the preservation of culture and identity.
Many experts predicted that Ukraine's fall would be a matter of weeks, yet it's been already
, and the Ukrainian military forces not only continue to stand strong but have also grown significantly stronger.

It's crucially important to continue fighting against this existential threat as well as remember ukrainian soldiers and people who gave their lives fighting for brighter future and freedom of Ukraine and whole Europe. This website is a tribute to all those who gave their lives for Ukraine.

On these pages, you will see the severe losses in personnel and military vehicles that the Ukrainian military has inflicted on the russian occupying forces, clearly demonstrating the strength and effectiveness of Ukraine's defense.

Stand against russian imperialistic aggression: Support Ukraine's Victory
Donate to Ukrainian Army or verified charity platforms
Consider donating to Open Source Intelligence contributors whose hard work allows to preserve and document all losses of russian invaders
WarSpotting is a database of documented losses in 2022 Russian invasion in Ukraine. They use photo evidences found across open sources on the web such as social media as proofs.

An official fundraising account created by NBU to support the Armed Forces of Ukraine. All collected funds are directed to enhance Ukraine's defense capability: weapons, equipment, food, medicine, and other supplies.

The Foundation stands with the Ukrainian Armed Forces by funding defensive initiatives. We supply technology, training, and ammunition. After arriving home from the front line of defense, our troops receive support with sports rehabilitation and the development of veteran-run businesses.
Government, Military, Medical, Humanitarian, Education and Science

The platform allows one-click donations to Ukraine from anywhere. Why is this so important? Because Ukraine itself knows best what is needed and can deliver aid directly. No one was ready for a full-scale war in the heart of Europe. Charitable foundations, no matter how well-organized, cannot meet the needs of a country as large as Ukraine. We can, however, do it together.
UNITED24 is designed for collaboration with charities, partners, donors, and public figures worldwide.

One of the UN's country-based pooled funds. Your donation will help humanitarian NGOs and UN agencies in Ukraine to assist the most vulnerable communities and people, and to provide them with urgently needed food, water, shelter, and other basic support.

Serhiy Prytula Charity Foundation is focused on strengthening the Defence Forces of Ukraine and providing assistance to the civilians affected by russian aggression. Over 200 volunteers and employees of the Foundation work every day to ensure that every donation we receive becomes valuable assistance to Ukraine.

All funds will be used to meet the needs of hospitals and emergency medical institutions that are the first to provide assistance to the wounded and enter the struggle for the life and health of Ukrainians.
List of verified ways to support Ukraine against russian invasion
